alert.note: Alert for Indian River; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 5:35PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Indian River and St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sebastian, Vero Beach, Fellsmere, Indian River Shores, Gifford, Vero Beach South, Winter Beach, Wabasso, Sebastian Highlands, Roseland, Pointe West, Vero Beach Highland, Vero Lake Estates, South Beach, Lakewood Park, Orchid, Vero Beach Airport, Grovenor Estates, Jaycee Beach and Florida Ridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
